item.title: Acting on instinct: Policing violence against women and girls in the night-time economy
item.description:
Authors: Mitchell & Rowe
Journal: International Journal of Police Science & Management

Globally, violence against women and girls (VAWG) is a pervasive issue which has wide-scale consequences. This paper focuses on VAWG in the context of the night-time economy (NTE), and the policing strategies targeted at its prevention. Using a mixed-methods approach, it identifies the centrality of police officer knowledge to operational practice.
